description: Three of New York’s most prominent hospitals are curbing gender affirming care for minors after President Donald Trump’s executive orders put at risk billions of dollars in federal funding.
title: NYC Hospitals Halt Some Gender Affirming Care After Trump Order

description: The Trump administration is set to announce it has formally seized a Venezuelan government plane that’s been held in the Dominican Republic since last year, a move that may complicate efforts to cooperate on deportations.
title: US Set to Announce Seizure of Venezuela Vice President’s Plane

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai looks at Trump’s surprise proposal for the Gaza Strip. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Expands His America First Philosophy Into New Territory

description: Poland’s President Andrzej Duda called for street protests if this year’s presidential vote is overturned as in Romania, where a top court recently voided an election due to allegations of foreign interference.
title: Polish President Calls for Protests If Presidential Vote Voided

description: The White House said Elon Musk, the billionaire leading President Donald Trump’s government cost-cutting efforts, will determine if there are conflicts of interest between his work reviewing federal spending and his overlapping empire of six companies.
title: White House Says Musk Will Police His Own Conflicts of Interest

description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker is warning federal employees in his state about risks related to the buyouts President Donald Trump and his advisor Elon Musk are offering to shrink the US government’s workforce.
title: Pritzker Warns Federal Workers in Illinois Against Musk Buyout

description: Senate Republicans broke with their House counterparts on pivotal legislation to carry out President Donald Trump’s agenda Wednesday after weeks of rising frustration with House Speaker Mike Johnson’s inability to overcome ideological infighting among lawmakers.
title: Republican Senators Break With House Over Trump Tax Cuts Strategy

description: The Pentagon said Wednesday that 10 undocumented migrants have been transported to its detention facilities in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, the latest effort by the Trump administration to demonstrate its aggressive use of the military to enforce immigration restrictions.
title: Pentagon Says 10 ‘High-Threat’ Migrants Arrive at Guantanamo Bay

description: Guatemala will accept 40% more deportation flights from the US and welcome migrants of other nationalities in transit to their home nations, President Bernardo Arevalo said alongside Secretary of State Marco Rubio.
title: Guatemala Agrees to Accept More Deportees During Rubio’s Visit

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the Trump administration had to take a hardline approach toward the US Agency for International Development because of resistance and “insubordination” by some of its staff toward efforts to conduct a more orderly review of its global programs.
title: Rubio Says ‘Insubordination’ Inside USAID Forced Sweeping Action

description: Quebec has long resisted proposals to build new oil and gas pipelines through its territory. US President Donald Trump’s threats against Canada might change that.
title: Quebec Says It’s Open to LNG, Oil Projects After Trump Threats

description: Two local lawmakers sued New York’s Nassau County and Executive Bruce Blakeman for creating what they claim is a “taxpayer funded militia” of armed civilians he could call into action to aid the government during emergencies.
title: Long Island County Sued Over Creation of Civilian ‘Militia’

description: A satellite communications system used by the US and UK to run military operations is central to efforts by Britain to resolve the sovereignty of the Chagos islands, UK security officials familiar with the matter said.
title: Control of US-UK Military Satellite System Is Key to Chagos Deal

description: Elon Musk’s team at the Department of Government Efficiency has been on-site at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to mine key systems for examples of what they consider fraud or waste, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Musk’s DOGE Team Mines for Fraud at Medicare and Medicaid Agency

description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou survived a no-confidence motion on Wednesday, assuring the adoption of a 2025 budget following months of political turmoil.
title: French Premier Survives No-Confidence Vote, Securing New Budget

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party looks set to return to power in India’s capital after almost three decades in a tightly-contested local election, some exit polls predicted.
title: Exit Polls Predict Modi Winning India’s Capital After Decades

description: A federal judge in Maryland has blocked President Donald Trump’s move to restrict automatic birthright citizenship, handing Trump another legal setback in his effort to upend more than a century of US policy as part of a broader immigration crackdown.
title: Second US Judge Blocks Trump Birthright Citizenship Order

description: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren urged President Donald Trump to work with regulators to stop what she called unjustified closing of bank accounts held by citizens and businesses, arguing that efforts to mute the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will worsen the problem.
title: Elizabeth Warren Urges Trump to Support CFPB Efforts to Fight Debanking

description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince sees an opportunity to get a defense, technology and nuclear cooperation deal but he will have to tread carefully given his young population has reawakened to the Palestinian cause amid the war in Gaza.
title: MBS Torn Between Trump and Saudi People on Potential Israel Deal

description: US allies expect President Donald Trump’s administration to present a long-awaited plan to end Russia’s war on Ukraine at the Munich Security Conference in Germany next week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Set to Unveil Trump’s Plan to End Three-Year War in Ukraine

description: The European Union’s member states have fallen short in improving their ability to quickly deploy armed forces in case of conflict, according to the bloc’s spending watchdog.
title: Europe Faulted for Inability to Quickly Deploy Troops and Arms

description: Unlike other Latin American leaders, El Salvador’s president is more than embracing US plans to move millions of undocumented migrants off its soil
title: Bukele Offers El Salvador’s Infamous Prison in Bid to Charm Trump

description: The leaders of Ukraine and Russia signaled that their previous refusal to talk to each other has softened, following US President Donald Trump’s promise to end Moscow’s full-scale invasion.
title: Ukraine, Russia Leaders Soften Their Stance Against Direct Talks

description: Argentina announced on Wednesday that it will leave the World Health Organization as President Javier Milei seeks to align his policies with those of Donald Trump in the US.
title: Argentina Leaves World Health Organization in Nod to Trump

description: Residents in the Russian city of Astrakhan have complained of a strong industrial odor as a major gas and condensate refinery works to restore operations after a Ukrainian drone attack.
title: Gas Odor Swamps Russian City as Refinery Deals With Drone Damage

description: Turkey is seeking more than seven years in prison for Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu over allegedly criminal comments he made about the city’s chief prosecutor, the state-run Anadolu Agency reported.
title: Turkey’s Main Rival to Erdogan Faces Jail Time in New Indictment

description: The UK government is working with the Bank of England on proposals to relax regulations for smaller banks and allow them to offer billions of pounds in extra lending to support economic growth.
title: UK Considering Easing Small Bank Capital Rules, Minister Says

description: A group of unions asked for a temporary court order to stop the US Treasury Department from handing over personal and financial data on Americans to people associated with Elon Musk’s team of government efficiency enforcers.
title: Unions Asks Court to Block Treasury From Giving Data to Musk’s DOGE

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro’s government was thrown into disarray after a televised cabinet meeting descended into chaos and tears.
title: Colombia’s Government Shaken After Televised Cabinet Quarrel

description: Bulgaria’s President Rumen Radev urged the European Union to not let itself be sidelined by Russia and the US in potential peace talks over Ukraine.
title: Bulgaria President Slams EU for Taking Backseat on Ukraine Peace

description: South Africa’s ruling coalition appears to be back on track after months of infighting between its two main members.
title: South Africa’s Coalition Government Smooths Over Its Differences

description: Chevron Corp. is in communication with the Trump administration as some Republicans call for the US to revoke the company’s license to operate in Venezuela.
title: Chevron Is in Contact With Trump Administration Over Venezuela

description: Novo Nordisk A/S is prepared for potential tariffs from US President Donald Trump, the Danish drugmaker’s chief executive said, as tensions simmer between Copenhagen and Washington.
title: Novo Nordisk Is Prepared for Trump’s Tariff Threat, CEO Says

description: Hungary will give grants to pensioners in rural villages to help them renovate their homes, as Prime Minister Viktor Orban looks to boost flagging support before key elections.
title: Orban Targets Rural Pensioners With Spending Before Hungary Vote

description: Germany, France and Italy are stepping up their lobbying for an urgent review into weaknesses in Europe’s banking sector, including options to help lenders compete with huge American rivals.
title: Top EU Nations Intensify Push to Make Banks More Competitive

description: US President Donald Trump’s idea of taking over a depopulated Gaza was broadly welcomed in Israel, with officials praising the surprise proposal as a means to beef up security following the war with Hamas.
title: Trump Idea for US Takeover of Gaza Stokes Middle East Divisions

description: The US Postal Service said it’s accepting “all international inbound mail and packages” from China and Hong Kong Posts, walking back an announcement made only hours earlier to halt some overseas shipments.
title: US Postal Service Reverses Decision to Halt China Shipments

description: Denmark will ramp up inspections of ships transporting Russian oil through its narrow straits, in an effort to protect the environment and maritime safety from older vessels in Moscow’s shadow fleet.
title: Denmark to Intensify Scrutiny of Russia’s Shadow Fleet Tankers

description: One of Kazakhstan’s richest men is in talks to pay about $1 billion to the state as part of a government investigation into wealth accumulated under the country’s first president.
title: Kazakh Tycoon in Talks on Making $1 Billion Payout to the State

description: Almost every day since the expansion of Canada’s Trans Mountain pipeline was completed in May, a tanker laden with oil sands crude shipped through the line has passed under Vancouver’s Lions Gate Bridge en route to refineries around the Pacific.
title: Canada Eyes More Ways to Ship Oil to China as US Threatens Trade

description: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday he’s willing to immediately start working on a new nuclear deal with Iran that allows the country to “peacefully grow and prosper,” seemingly softening his stance on the Islamic Republic.
title: Trump Says He Wants New Nuclear Deal Allowing Iran to ‘Prosper’

description: The Malian government’s overhaul of its extraction industry risks deterring companies from investing in the nation that’s home to the world’s second-largest gold mine, according to Anglo American Plc Chief Executive Officer Duncan Wanblad.
title: Anglo CEO Says Mali Mining Developments Cause for Grave Concern

description: Oklahoma is poised to become the first Republican state to try to use its influence as an investor to end DEI in corporate America, targeting companies including Amazon.com Inc. and Alphabet Inc. in shareholder proxy proposals.
title: Amazon, Alphabet Targeted as Oklahoma Joins Anti-DEI Investor Ranks

description: Mark Carney plans to announce he won’t follow through with a proposed increase to Canada’s capital gains tax if he wins the Liberal Party leadership race and becomes prime minister, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Carney to Propose Scrapping Canada’s Capital Gains Tax Increase

description: Over a frantic 72 hours, President Donald Trump’s threat of punishing new tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China sent stocks and currencies tumbling and shock waves through world trade.
title: ‘Race to the Border’: Manufacturers Scramble Under Trump’s Looming Tariffs

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Gaza Is Next to Feel Trump’s Disruptive Gaze

description: South Africa’s government signaled that it is making headway in resolving an impasse over a new national medical-insurance plan that critics say will infringe on the rights of patients and health-care workers and sideline the private sector.
title: South Africa Signals Breakthrough in Health-Insurance Impasse

description: President Donald Trump made it sound logical and straightforward. The US, the most powerful country on Earth, would take over the Gaza Strip after a year and a half of devastating war, remove its damaged buildings and unexploded ordnance, and rebuild the place, Trump said on Feb. 4. Meanwhile, he said, Gazans should be taken in by neighboring countries and given access to lives so “beautiful” they wouldn’t want to return.
title: A US Takeover of an Emptied Gaza? Why Trump’s Proposals Are Shocking

description: Congressional Republicans have managed barely a whimper as President Donald Trump wages a historic push to expand executive branch power, steamrolling them along the way and unleashing anxiety across the federal government.
title: GOP Lawmakers Cede to Trump, Musk Power Grab Without a Challenge

description: One in four of Britain’s services firms put up prices at the start of 2025 amid rising wage bills and the imminent hit from Labour’s £26 billion hike in payroll taxes.
title: UK Services Firms Put Up Prices at Fastest Pace in a Year

description: Norway sees a growing threat of sabotage attempts by Russian intelligence services, including against the energy infrastructure in western Europe’s largest fossil-fuels exporter.
title: Norway Sees Higher Risk of Russians Sabotaging Energy Assets

description: What is the Bureau of the Fiscal Service?
title: The Treasury Payment System Elon Musk Now Has Access To

description: Elon Musk and his Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) have gained access to a unit within the Treasury Department called the Bureau of Fiscal Service. But what does this unit actually do? How critical of a role does it play in the operations of government, and potentially, financial markets? On this episode, we speak with Nathan Tankus, the author of the Notes On The Crises newsletter. He explains both the technical aspect of this office, as well as the legal questions surrounding impound
title: Odd Lots: The US Payment System Musk Now Has Access To (Podcast)

description: Donald Trump’s plan to rebuild the devastated Gaza Strip as a new “Riviera” appears to be taking a page from his playbook with Kim Jong Un, when the US leader floated a coastal real estate development plan in exchange for North Korea’s denuclearization.
title: Trump Tried and Failed to Lure Kim Jong Un to Peace With Beachfront Condo Plan

description: China accused the US of disregarding its help on combating the fentanyl crisis, after President Donald Trump slapped a blanket 10% tariff on Beijing over the flow of illegal drugs into America.
title: China Accuses Trump of Disregarding Its Help on Fentanyl Crisis

description: Thai companies want the government to step up efforts to shield local producers from a potential influx of cheap goods following the Trump administration’s move to slap tariffs on Chinese imports.
title: Thai Industry Braces for Influx of Chinese Goods After US Tariff

description: Lawmakers from the Philippines’ House of Representatives impeached Vice President Sara Duterte on Wednesday.
title: Philippines’ House of Representatives Impeaches VP Duterte

description: Ugandan police arrested at least nine Finance Ministry officials amid an investigation into the loss of 60 billion shillings ($16 million) from the central bank after the money was sent to unintended recipients.
title: Uganda Arrests Treasury Officials After Central Bank Cash Heist

description: Indonesia’s energy minister apologized for a policy that banned small retailers from selling canisters of subsidized cooking gas used by millions of households, scrapping the move that led to long lines and sparked public anger.
title: Indonesia Scraps Policy That Led to Long Queues for Cooking Gas

description: Malaysia’s Attorney General’s Chambers is seeking to block jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak’s court bid to serve the remainder of his 1MDB-linked prison sentence at home.
title: Malaysia Seeks to Block Ex-PM Najib’s House Arrest Bid

description: The Philippines’ House of Representatives has sufficient votes to impeach Vice President Sara Duterte, local radio DZBB reported, citing House Secretary General Reginald Velasco.
title: Philippines House Has Enough Votes to Impeach VP Duterte: DZBB

description: Opposition leaders, journalists and even a celebrity agent have been caught up in a wave of arrests and investigations ahead of peace talks with the Kurdish PKK.
title: Arrests and Judicial Probes Spark Fear of a New Turkey Crackdown

description: Europe shouldn’t complain. This is a cost of its defense failures.
title: Trump’s Resource Grab in Ukraine Is a Price Worth Paying

description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou is set to ride out two no-confidence votes on Wednesday, giving him the stability needed to implement a delayed 2025 budget.
title: French Premier Set to Survive No-Confidence Votes, Adopt Budget

description: The Central Intelligence Agency has offered staff buyouts to shrink the workforce in line with the Trump administration’s broader job cuts across the government and to sharpen the spy service’s focus on top priorities like China.
title: CIA Offers Staff Buyouts as Trump Looks to Shrink Workforce

description: Most employees of the US Agency for International Development will be placed on administrative leave starting Friday.
title: Most USAID Staff Across the World Will Be Put on Leave This Week

description: The US Postal Service said that it would temporarily suspend the acceptance of inbound international packages from China and Hong Kong Posts until further notice.
title: US Postal Service Suspends Inbound Parcels From China, Hong Kong

description: Liquefied natural gas and tungsten — a metal used in the defense and energy industries — are the commodities on the front lines of the opening salvo of the US-China trade war.
title: China Wields Commodities Leverage with LNG and Tungsten Curbs

description: Pam Bondi was confirmed by the US Senate to lead Donald Trump’s Justice Department on Tuesday evening in Washington, letting her take over a sprawling agency central to the administration’s efforts on antitrust, immigration and policing white-collar crime.
title: Bondi Confirmed as Trump’s Attorney General to Lead DOJ Shake-Up

description: India’s capital holds local elections Wednesday, in a crucial test for Prime Minister Narendra Modi whose party has failed to wrestle control of Delhi from a small but formidable rival for over a decade now.
title: Modi Faces First Major Electoral Test After Historic Tax Cuts

description: Donald Trump is poised to see nearly every nominee for his cabinet confirmed after Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and Tulsi Gabbard cleared critical Senate hurdles on Tuesday, in the latest demonstration of the president’s hold over fellow Republicans.
title: Trump’s Pressure Campaign for Cabinet Nominees Is Paying Off

description: Colombia’s first-ever televised cabinet meeting descended into acrimony as President Gustavo Petro’s ministers traded barbs and aired personal grievances.
title: Televised Colombian Cabinet Meeting Descends Into Rancor, Tears

description: Panama’s Jose Raul Mulino had already done a lot to appease the incoming American president. He’d clamped down on migration routes and declared his country the new southern border for the US.
title: An Asset Too Precious to Cede Makes Panama Leader a Trump Target

description: Ireland’s foreign and trade minister will seek approval to establish a US-based body that will advise the government on how to deal with any potential policy changes from the administration of President Donald Trump.
title: Irish Minister Proposes US-Based Body to Tackle Trump Trade Risk

description: A “troubling culture” within the UK’s Home Office is leading to millions of pounds of waste at the expense of the taxpayer, an influential committee of lawmakers has found.
title: UK Wasting Millions on Asylum-Seeker Housing Deals, Report Says
